command.name: install
command.summary: Install a package. Use install --plugin to install plugins

option.name: packagingroot
option.doc: Install the package in a directory in preparation for packaging with tools like RPM

option.name: optionaldeps
option.doc: Automatically download and install all optional dependencies

option.name: force
option.doc: Force the installation to proceed independent of errors. USE SPARINGLY.

argument.name: package
argument.doc: package.xml, local package archive, remove package archive, or abstract package.

command.doc:
Installs listed packages.
local package.xml example: php pyrus.phar install package.xml
local package archive example: php pyrus.phar install PackageName-1.2.0.tar
remote package archive example: php pyrus.phar install http://www.example.com/PackageName-1.2.0.tgz
Examples of an abstract package: php pyrus.phar install PackageName installs PackageName from the default channel with stability preferred_state php pyrus.phar pear/PackageName installs PackageName from the pear.php.net channel with stability preferred_state php pyrus.phar install channel://doc.php.net/PackageName installs PackageName from the doc.php.net channel with stability preferred_state php pyrus.phar install PackageName-beta installs PackageName from the default channel, beta or stable stability php pyrus.phar install PackageName-1.2.0 installs PackageName from the default channel, version 1.2.0

command.name: upgrade
command.summary: Upgrade a package. Use upgrade --plugin to upgrade plugins

option.name: optionaldeps
option.doc: Automatically download and install all optional dependencies

option.name: force
option.doc: Force the installation to proceed independent of errors. USE SPARINGLY.

argument.name: package
argument.doc: package.xml, local package archive, remove package archive, or abstract package.

command.doc:
Installs or upgrades listed packages.
local package.xml example: php pyrus.phar install package.xml
local package archive example: php pyrus.phar install PackageName-1.2.0.tar
remote package archive example: php pyrus.phar install http://www.example.com/PackageName-1.2.0.tgz
Examples of an abstract package: php pyrus.phar install PackageName installs PackageName from the default channel with stability preferred_state php pyrus.phar pear/PackageName installs PackageName from the pear.php.net channel with stability preferred_state php pyrus.phar install channel://doc.php.net/PackageName installs PackageName from the doc.php.net channel with stability preferred_state php pyrus.phar install PackageName-beta installs PackageName from the default channel, beta or stable stability php pyrus.phar install PackageName-1.2.0 installs PackageName from the default channel, version 1.2.0

command.name: uninstall
command.summary: Uninstall a package. Use uninstall --plugin to uninstall plugins

option.name: force
option.doc: Force the uninstallation to proceed independent of errors. USE SPARINGLY.

command.doc:
Uninstall a package
Uninstalls packages.
Example: php pyrus.phar uninstall PackageName uninstalls [default channel]/PackageName php pyrus.phar uninstall channelname/PackageName uninstalls package PackageName from channel channelname.

command.name: build
command.summary: Build a PHP extension package from source and install the compiled extension
command.doc:
Build a PECL package from source, and install the compiled extension.
This command is used to build an extension. It performs an automatic version of:
phpize --clean phpize ./configure make make install
In the source directory of the package.

command.name: download
command.summary: Download a remote package to the current directory

argument.name: package
argument.doc: package.xml, local package archive, remove package archive, or abstract package.

command.doc:
Download a remote package.
This command downloads a package to the current directory. It can download a remote package or copy a local package (although cp may be more efficient)

command.name: list-packages
command.summary: List all installed packages in all channels
command.doc:
List all installed packages.
This command lists all installed packages organized by channel and by installation location.

command.name: list-channels
command.doc:
List all discovered channels.
This command lists channels already known. Use channel-discover or channel-add to add a new channel.

command.name: channel-discover
command.doc:
Discover a new channel.
This command searches for a channel.xml first at a secure and then unsecured http address.
Examples: php pyrus.phar channel-discover pear.example.com This tries to locate https://pear.example.com/channel.xml and if that fails, http://pear.example.com/channel.xml, and then adds the channel to the registry.
Use channel-add to add a local channel.xml to the registry

command.name: channel-add
command.summary: Add a new channel to the registry
command.doc:
Add a new channel to the registry.
Use channel-discover to add a remote channel to the registry.

command.name: channel-del
command.summary: Remove a channel from the registry
command.doc:
Remove an existing channel from the registry.
pear2.php.net, pear.php.net, pecl.php.net, and doc.php.net cannot be removed from the registry.

command.name: upgrade-registry
command.summary: Upgrade an old PEAR installation to the new registry format

argument.name: path
argument.doc: Path to PEAR registry to upgrade

command.doc:
Upgrade an old PEAR installation to the new Sqlite and XML registry.
This command does not remove the old PEAR registry, but creates a duplicate in the new Sqlite and XML formats, so that Pyrus can take advantage of the greater stability and speed of the new format.

command.name: run-scripts
command.summary: Run all post-install scripts for a package

argument.name: package
argument.doc: Package name for which to run post-install scripts

command.doc:
Run all post-install scripts for a package.
This command runs each post-install script, and is interactive, prompting for answers to queries posed by the post-install script, and executes based on the answers provided.

command.name: config-show
command.doc:
List all configuration values.
This lists configuration values, organized by system configuration settings and user configuration settings.

command.name: set

argument.name: variable
argument.doc: Configuration variable name. This can be a system or user variable.

command.doc:
Set a configuration variable.
For example: php pyrus.phar set download_dir /home/blah/downloads

command.name: mypear

argument.name: path
argument.doc: Set the path of your preferred PEAR locations.

command.doc:
Set the path of your preferred PEAR locations.
For example: to set a local PEAR install at /home/user/pear and a system install at /usr/local/lib/php, do
php pyrus.phar mypear /home/user/pear /usr/local/lib/php
On windows: php pyrus.phar mypear "C:\Documents and Settings\User\pear" C:\php5
This is a convenience alias to the set command with my_pear_path.

command.name: help
command.summary: Get help on a particular command, or all commands

argument.name: command
argument.doc: Command to get help on. Leave blank to get help on all commands

command.doc: Get detailed help on a command.
